Package net.joala.testlet

Testlets are set of tests to apply to a software under test (SUT).

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Testlet A testlet is a set of tests to run.
 

Class Summary
AbstractTestlet<T> Abstract implementation which handles starting the tests.
ExceptionClassTestlet<T extends Throwable> Test an exception and its constructors.
ToStringTestlet<T> Tests some requirements for the toString() method.
UtilityClassTestlet Test to verify if provided class meets utility class requirements.
 

Package net.joala.testlet Description

Testlets are set of tests to apply to a software under test (SUT). Testlets itself contain multiple tests which are run with the provided SUT to see if it meets a bunch of requirements specified through the testlet.

A typical testlet is the toString() testlet: It assumes that you want to put all fields of a class into the toString() output and that the classname itself should be mentioned in the resulting output. The testlet verifies these assumptions.

Since:
10/4/12
